page.title: 02Overton and Fyfield Downland
page.content: The conservation of the downs is important because there are lots of rare plants there. The downs mostly have gentle slopes. In the winter some are good for sledging on. You can walk on the downs as it is public land. A lot of visitors go there to see "Devil's Den" which is where the devil was thought to linger. Part of it was pulled down for this very reason. There are many large stones called grey wethers (wethers meaning sheep). It is believed that they mark the course of ancient streams. Stones at {Avebury}and{Stonehenge}probably came from Overton and Fyfield Downs.
